Accuracy.description: A Hero may use Heroic Accuracy (as long as they aren't engaged in combat) to re-roll failed In The Way Rolls during the Shoot Phase. A Hero model performing Heroic Accuracy may choose to shout "Take Aim!". Any friendly models within 6" of that point may also re-roll failed In The Way Rolls during the Shoot Phase

Challenge.description: A Hero using Heroic Challenge must be in base contact with an enemy Hero of the same tier or higher. If the Heroic Challenge is accepted no other models partake in the duel or strikes stage of the fight between the Hero models. Both Hero models must engage each other until one is slain, the victorious Hero gains 1D3 Might points. If the Heroic Challenge is declined, any Heroic Actions that the declining Hero makes will not affect any friendly models until the Hero who issued the Challenge is slain. The declining Hero model may not use Stand Fast! for the rest of the game.

Channelling.description: A Hero using Heroic Channelling will use the Channelled versions of any magical powers this turn.

Combat.description: A Heroic Combat enables a Hero model to resolve their fight first – defying the usual Priority system. If all enemies in the fight are slain, the Hero and any friendly models engaged in the same fight may move (or charge) again before proceeding with the Fight Phase in normal priority order.

Defence.description: A Hero that declares a Heroic Defence will only suffer a wound on the roll of a natural 6 during the Fight Phase. This also applies to 6/4+, 6/5+ & 6/6 rolls to wound. Mounts do not benefit from this Heroic Action.

March.description: A Hero model who uses a Heroic March adds (depending on their troop keyword) 3" for Infantry or 5" for Cavalry / Fly to their maximum Move distance. Models who utilise a Heroic March may not Charge in the same Move phase. A Hero model who is conducting a Heroic March may choose to shout “At The Double!” to enable friendly models within 6" to also benefit from the Heroic March

Move.description: A Heroic Move enables a Hero model to move before other models – defying the usual Priority system. The Hero can then Move, Jump, Climb, Charge and Stand Fast! A Hero model performing a Heroic Move may choose to shout “With Me!”. Any friendly models within 6" of that point may also move, so long as they end their move within 6" of the Hero (if they are not able to end within 6" of the Hero or choose not to move then they may not move at all this phase).

Resolve.description: When A Hero declares a Heroic Resolve the action takes places straight away. All friendly models that are within 6" of the Hero receive +1 dice when rolling to resist for the rest of the current turn (Warrior and Hero models with no Will Points remaining get one dice rather than none). The Hero calling a Heroic Resolve is unable to move in the same turn.

Shoot.description: Heroic Shoot enables a Hero model to shoot before other models get a chance. A Hero cannot perform a Heroic Shoot if they are Engaged in combat. A Hero performing a Heroic Shoot may shout "Loose!" if they wish, enabling all friendly models within 6" to shoot with them.

Strength.description: A Hero that declares a Heroic Strength adds 1D3 to their Strength value for this turn. It may not increase the value above 10 and is applied before other rules are calculated.

Strike.description: A Hero that declares a Heroic Strike adds 1D6 to their Fight value for this turn. It may not increase the value above 10 and is applied before other rules are calculated.
